Docs.summary: Provides a base class for property tabs.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> class provides the base class behavior for a property tab. Property tabs are displayed on the toolbar of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> control of the Properties window, and allow a component to display different views of its properties or other data.
User code will usually not create an instance of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> directly. Instead, a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabAttribute> that indicates the type of the property tab or property tabs to display for a component can be associated with the properties or types that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> should be displayed for.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> will instantiate a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> of the type specified by a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabAttribute> associated with the type or property field of the component that is being browsed.
## Examples The following code example provides an example <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> that lists any properties on a component, arranged by type name.
[!code-cpp[PropertyTabExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PropertyTabExample/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[PropertyTabExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PropertyTabExample/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[PropertyTabExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PropertyTabExample/VB/class1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Releases all the resources used by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> in an unusable state. After calling <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> was occupying. For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab>. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> object's `Finalize` method.

Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. `Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> references. This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

block.para:
can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Overriding the Finalize Method](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/ddae83kx(v=vs.100)).
